content.raw:
I wasn't planing of making a PR until the test is finished, but, I have a problem and do want to know what you would think about something,

Question: For triggering the events, well currently I can test individual buttons, checkboxes, radios .. but unfortunately they don't trigger the events that they are bind to, like in [line](#!/osrf/gzweb/pull-requests/110/scene-test/diff#Ltest/gzscene_test.jsT357),  I can emit the event to test the manipulation mode changing, 
while sth like this wouldn't have an effect 
```
$('#translate-mode').click()
```
well I can test elements individually, with no triggering,
```
          var spyEvent = spyOnEvent('#translate-mode', 'click')
          $('#translate-mode').click()
          expect('click').toHaveBeenTriggeredOn('#translate-mode')
          expect(spyEvent).toHaveBeenTriggered()
```
I believe this [stackoverflow answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/11192263/4739966) explains why.
So the question, would it be ok to test clicks on their own and the events on their own?
content.html:
I wasn't planing of making a PR until the test is finished, but, I have a problem and do want to know what you would think about something,

Question: For triggering the events, well currently I can test individual buttons, checkboxes, radios .. but unfortunately they don't trigger the events that they are bind to, like in line, I can emit the event to test the manipulation mode changing, while sth like this wouldn't have an effect 

$('#translate-mode').click()

well I can test elements individually, with no triggering,

          var spyEvent = spyOnEvent('#translate-mode', 'click')
          $('#translate-mode').click()
          expect('click').toHaveBeenTriggeredOn('#translate-mode')
          expect(spyEvent).toHaveBeenTriggered()

I believe this stackoverflow answer explains why. So the question, would it be ok to test clicks on their own and the events on their own?

content.raw: I think it's ok to test things separately now, we can think  of more elaborate integration tests in the future.
content.html: I think it's ok to test things separately now, we can think of more elaborate integration tests in the future.

content.raw: On branch `test_model_spawning`, I am able to get rid of the `length` error by adding a `done()` in the end of the test. Is there a reason you're not calling done?
content.html: On branch test_model_spawning, I am able to get rid of the length error by adding a done() in the end of the test. Is there a reason you're not calling done?

content.raw:
If I added the ```done()``` the second test then fails.
 I removed the done because I wanted jasmine to wait in the first test until the time out ```jasmine.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL = 1000;``` so that when the second test starts the ```modelStats```  would have be calculated.
content.html: If I added the done() the second test then fails. I removed the done because I wanted jasmine to wait in the first test until the time out jasmine.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL = 1000; so that when the second test starts the modelStats would have be calculated.

content.raw: The sdfparser's constructor calls `this.scene.setSDFParser(this);`, so I think technically we don't need to call it again. This is probably something which can be improved on the API, because I don't think passing an sdfparser created with one scene to another scene by calling `setSDFParser` will work properly.
content.html: The sdfparser's constructor calls this.scene.setSDFParser(this);, so I think technically we don't need to call it again. This is probably something which can be improved on the API, because I don't think passing an sdfparser created with one scene to another scene by calling setSDFParser will work properly.
